column4: &&Help&& I installed Linux onto my HD, not I would like to  put windows on another Partition..when I went to install Windows it said unknown harddrive!.. I would like to "break a piece" off of my Linux Partition *which is the whole harddrive* and give it to windows..can this be done without a reformat???
*now
are the windows and linux partitions on physically separate drives?
sorry..Its on one harddrive..one partition..linux is the only OS right now.. I would like to break a piece off of Linux's partition and give it to windows to use.. its this possible?
you dont "Break" a partition :P you resize them
and yes, you can resize the linux partition so that windows has more room to play with
although installing windows will make you unable to boot into linux
why?
because windows only tolerates booting alongside other versions of windows (and maybe a few other OSs, certainly not linux)
if you install linux after you install windows then yes you can
once you install windows, you will have to put grub back onto the mbr.  grub tolerates windows, windows doesn't tolerate anything else
can this be done without the risk of losing anything from Linux?
yes, the linux partition shouldn't be touched at all
but linux's boot loader will be removed
So how do I restore it and save my info and my linux?
